instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Buzzing Sound
threads.message:
Hi My right speaker buzzes whenever i open youtube or start playing any sound.
I tried with another speaker - but same.

The board has no corrossion as such.
J6603 - Diode Mode Reading
Pin 3/4/5/6/7/8 = .584
Pin 9/10/11 = .584
Pin 12/13/14 = .588

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Buzzing Sound
threads.message: There was corossion under <CHIP>U6440</CHIP>. Removed - Cleaned - ReInstalled. Its less buzzing but its still there. Should we change it ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Buzzing Sound
threads.message:
You should do that.
May also have another surrounding caps affected by corrosion.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Buzzing Sound
threads.message:
Before Replacing the <CHIP>U6440</CHIP> . Readings of surrounding caps.

<CAPACITOR>C6447</CAPACITOR> is .947
<CAPACITOR>C6440</CAPACITOR>/1 is .364
<CAPACITOR>C6442</CAPACITOR> is .567
<CAPACITOR>C6448</CAPACITOR> is .596
<CAPACITOR>C6443</CAPACITOR>/4 is .412

Seems okay? Should we replace ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Buzzing Sound
threads.message:
If can't clearly see corroded caps, change <CHIP>U6440</CHIP>.
Once the chip is removed, check trace continuity from its pads to surrounding components.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Buzzing Sound
